FuncDef:
The holdtime join-prune command globally sets the holdtime for Join/Prune messages sent by PIM interfaces.
The undo holdtime join-prune command restores the default value. The holdtime join-prune command globally sets the holdtime for Join/Prune messages sent by PIM interfaces. The undo holdtime join-prune command restores the default value. By default, the holdtime value in Join/Prune messages sent by all PIM interfaces is 210 seconds.
ParentView: VPN instance PIM view,PIM view of a public network instance

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the holdtime for Join/Prune messages sent by the local router.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: After receiving a Join/Prune message from a downstream interface, an upstream router determines the time period for keeping the join or prune state of a downstream interface based on the holdtime field carried in the Join/Prune message. To set a value for the holdtime field, run the holdtime join-prune command. Generally, the holdtime is 3.5 times the interval (specified using the timer join-prune command) at which Join/Prune messages are sent.
